page.title: 04Local History ,Gipsey Bridge
page.content: An 81 year old woman who lives in Gipsey Bridge village remembers her life well. She has lived in her house for 50 years. She remembers World War 1 and 11 well. There were many Zeppelins and they made a big noise. Life was very hard in those early days of her life. She worked as a servant in a grand house called Frithville Stud her transport in those days was by bicycle or she walkedto work. She used to go to Boston her nearest town by carriers cart. She met her husband to-be at school.Her main event of the year was a day out to Skegness which cost her a shilling or 5p.Each week she used to go to Sunday School. Her day-to-day living has much improved but she finds people not so friendly there are more outings and pleasure comes more.
